result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur S. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Arthur S. Clark is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Arthur S. Clark was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur S. Clark

records.addlTxt: Satisfaction of Commitment - Deft completed work crew in lieu of fine and costs

ADDRESS INFO for Arthur S. Clark
Current: 1827 65th St  Apt 2, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 06-18-2015)
Prior: 5402 75th Street  #1, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158
For Ct 1 only - Dismissed

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Arthur S. Clark, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 90 days in the KCJ commencing on 6/27/15 at 8:00 AM with credit for 40 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.   Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and written notice provided to defendant.  Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied and remaining balance is due in 30 days or Civil Judgment.   Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Posted $100 on 5/20/15
atty: William Michel
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Per email response from Atty Edwards no PD has been appointed yet.  Speedy Trial scheduled for 7/6 at 8:30 AM and notice sent to PD's Office.  FPT moved to 6/18/15 at 8:30 AM since trial has been scheduled during ADA Trigg's week.
Jury trial on July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
